events.title: Victory over Japan Day (V-J Day) Announcement
events.description: Japan announces its surrender in World War II, effectively ending the war.
events.significance: Marked the end of World War II, leading to peace and the beginning of post-war reconstruction globally.

events.title: Boxer Rebellion Ends
events.description: The Boxer Protocol is signed by China, ending the Boxer Rebellion against foreign influence.
events.significance: Restored foreign powers' influence in China and had lasting effects on Chinese sovereignty and foreign relations.

events.title: Pakistan Independence Day
events.description: Pakistan gains independence from British rule and is established as a separate nation.
events.significance: Signaled the creation of Pakistan as a sovereign state, leading to major geopolitical changes in South Asia.

events.title: President Roosevelt Signs Social Security Act
events.description: The U.S. Social Security Act is signed into law, creating a system of old-age benefits and unemployment insurance.
events.significance: Laid the groundwork for the American welfare state and social security system still in place today.
